str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.
Of Hebrew origin; Israel, the adopted name of Jacob, including his descendants.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
All, the whole, entire, complete. A primary word; 'whole' or 'all', i.e. Complete, especially as noun or adverb.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To spread (stretch) out, expand, extend. From ek and a form of petomai; to fly out, i.e. to extend.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: To disobey, rebel, be disloyal, refuse conformity. From apeithes; to disbelieve.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: To speak or say in opposition, contradict (oppose, resist). From anti and lego; to dispute, refuse.
Apparently a primary word; a people.
